text: ~ @ Kavoukis Anastasios added a comment - 23.04.2024 1:00 PM - edited Point 3.1.7 in TTTech Tutorial - Create new branch for TTTech Auto/JND repositories Those commands will generate a file called rirk jnd.txt containing all repos starting from rtrk and jnd d AOSP-manifest git checkout aed2_ RTRK C3D_QC_12.10.1 grep -Poh ‘(?<=name=")\S*(?=")' aed2-devicexml | grep Artrk >> rtrk jnd.txt grep -Poh ‘(?<=name=")\S*(?=")' aed2-devicexml | grep Ajnd >> rtrk jnd.txt To avoid re cloning everything (as the tutorial mentions) cd to an existing checkout of the AOSP project. In my case: “cd ~/aed2/snapdragon-auto-gen3-la-3-4-2_ap_standard_oem/apps/LINUX/android" Run the repo forall command pointing the previously created file In my case was “~/aed2/AOSP-manifest/rirk jnd.txt" repo forall $(tr\n'** < ~/aed2/AOSP-manifest/rirk jnd.txt) -c git checkout aed2_RTRK_C3D_QC_12.10.1 && git pull && git checkout -b aed2_ FDIN_C3D_QC_12.11.2 && git push -—set-upstream origin aed2_FDJN_C3D_QC_12.11.2" used "&&" for each command instead of ;'to ensure that previous command succeeded.
